intro: Senecio orizabensis, commonly known as the Orizaba groundsel, is a flowering plant native to Mexico. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or limestone soils and thrives in high-altitude environments. Its leaves are usually lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its flowers range from yellow to orange in color. Senecio orizabensis is often found in open, sunny habitats and is adapted to arid or semi-arid conditions.
